title: Artists in Conversation: Cindy Sherman
description: Cindy Sherman's earliest photographic work displayed her posed tauntingly in sets. Mimicry, mostly of '50s and '60s film, they anticipated a voyeuristic response. Then the photographs moved into a more intimate relationship between her and the camera: no costumes or props; but Sherman emoting-loneliness, fear, etc.

title: How I Made It: Cindy Sherman on Her 'Untitled Film Stills'
description: I n the "Film Stills," which you made between 1977 and 1980, you created a cast of women, all played by yourself, who seemed to be playing classic movie roles. How did the series start? When I moved to New York, in the summer of '77, I was trying to think of a new way to take pictures and tell a story.

title: Cindy Sherman: Becoming
description: Cecil Beaton once said that "making oneself a work of art" was "that most difficult of all causes." Cindy Sherman not only does that, she's given herself up entirely to the mission. For nearly four decades, she has been braiding together fashion, photography, and the strange internal magic of herself-dressing up, putting on makeup, doing her hair, donning wigs, and posing alone in her studio for the camera.

title: Cindy Sherman
description: Since 1977, when Cindy Sherman first exhibited her "untitled film Stills" of fictional B-movie starlets, she has surrendered herself to photographic portraits of nearly every female archetype imaginable. So completely does the artist disappear into her subjects-disheveled fashion victims, art-historical icons, tragic dowagers, manic clowns, Beverly Hills housewives-that it's hard to believe they are all the same woman.

title: Cindy Sherman
description: Cindy Sherman [Eva Respini, Johanna Burton, Cindy Sherman, John Waters] on Amazon.com. *FREE* shipping on qualifying offers. Published to accompany the first major survey of Cindy Sherman's work in the United States in nearly 15 years
author_name: Eva Respini, Johanna Burton, Cindy Sherman and John Waters

title: Cindy Sherman: Untitled Horrors
author_name: Miranda July, Christian Kracht, Lars Noren Sjon

title: The Pictures Generation, 1974–1984
description: The Pictures Generation, 1974-1984 [Douglas Eklund] on Amazon.com. *FREE* shipping on qualifying offers. Book by Douglas Eklund

title: The Last Picture Show: Artists Using Photography 1960–1982
Cindy Sherman: It Began with Madame de Pompadour
description: In 2008, twenty of Cindy Sherman's History Portraits (1989-1990) were exhibited at Skarstedt Gallery in New York City. In the following interview, Sherman walks Art21 through the exhibition and discusses the ideas behind individual photographs as well as the overall series. ART21: What was the impetus for History Portraits?

title: The Real Cindy Sherman
description: The famed artist Cindy Sherman discusses bringing a universe of characters to life through her photos.

title: At the Met, Baby Boomers Leap Onstage
description: Apart from a few years in the 1960s when the New York culture czar Henry Geldzahler tossed some stardust around, the Metropolitan Museum was a fusty backwater for contemporary art, and an object of scorn in the art world. New work seemed to arrive only in bland job-lot batches.

title: Photography’s Angel Provocateur
description: There are several conclusions to be drawn from the Museum of Modern Art's magnificent if somewhat flawed survey of Cindy Sherman 's brilliant career. But one of them is surely that reports of the death of the author have been greatly exaggerated.

title: Cindy Sherman: Me, Myself, and I
description: I give Cindy Sherman the once-over. Then the twice- and thrice-over. I know I'm staring more than is right but I can't help myself. I'm looking for clues. Sherman is one of the world's leading artists - for 30 years, she has starred in all her photographs - and yet the more we see of her, the less recognisable she is.

title: Cindy Sherman: History Portraits. The Rebirth of the Painted Picture after the End of Painting
Cindy Sherman: The Early Works: Catalogue Raisonné, 1975–1977

title: Cindy Sherman: The Complete Untitled Film Stills
description: Cindy Sherman: The Complete Untitled Film Stills [Peter Galassi, Cindy Sherman] on Amazon.com. *FREE* shipping on qualifying offers. Cindy Sherman's Untitled Film Stills , a series of 69 black-and-white photographs created between 1977 and 1980

title: Cindy Sherman: Interview with a Chameleon
description: Entwining self-portraiture, disguise, caricature, fantasy and social observation, Sherman has made staged photographs for decades that may command more admiration than affinity but gradually infiltrate one's vision of people beyond the frame. In making the "Untitled Film Stills," Sherman shot herself in various interior and outdoor settings, posing as actresses in imaginary dramatic movies.
